body_html:
Hi, I ran same code in grid_search_test.py and got the same error in TF 1.3.0, scikit-learn 0.19
Have you any idea?

import tensorflow as tf
from tensorflow.contrib import learn
from sklearn.model_selection import GridSearchCV
from sklearn import datasets
iris = datasets.load_iris()
feature_columns = learn.infer_real_valued_columns_from_input(iris.data)
classifier = learn.DNNClassifier(feature_columns=feature_columns, hidden_units=[10, 20, 10], n_classes=3)
grid_search = GridSearchCV(classifier, {'hidden_units': [[5, 5], [10, 10]]}, scoring='accuracy', fit_params={'steps': [50]})
grid_search.fit(iris.data, iris.target)

/Users/rickypark/anaconda/envs/handson-ml/lib/python3.6/site-packages/sklearn/model_selection/_search.py:583: DeprecationWarning: "fit_params" as a constructor argument was deprecated in version 0.19 and will be removed in version 0.21. Pass fit parameters to the "fit" method instead.
'"fit" method instead.', DeprecationWarning)
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
TypeError Traceback (most recent call last)
in ()
----> 1 grid_search.fit(iris.data, iris.target)

~/anaconda/envs/handson-ml/lib/python3.6/site-packages/sklearn/model_selection/_search.py in fit(self, X, y, groups, **fit_params)
622 n_candidates * n_splits))
623
--> 624 base_estimator = clone(self.estimator)
625 pre_dispatch = self.pre_dispatch
626

~/anaconda/envs/handson-ml/lib/python3.6/site-packages/sklearn/base.py in clone(estimator, safe)
60 for name, param in six.iteritems(new_object_params):
61 new_object_params[name] = clone(param, safe=False)
---> 62 new_object = klass(**new_object_params)
63 params_set = new_object.get_params(deep=False)
64

TypeError: init() got an unexpected keyword argument 'params'

Hi, I ran same code in grid_search_test.py and got the same error in TF 1.3.0, scikit-learn 0.19
Have you any idea?
import tensorflow as tf
from tensorflow.contrib import learn
from sklearn.model_selection import GridSearchCV
from sklearn import datasets
iris = datasets.load_iris()
feature_columns = learn.infer_real_valued_columns_from_input(iris.data)

grid_search = GridSearchCV(classifier, {'hidden_units': [[5, 5], [10, 10]]}, scoring='accuracy', fit_params={'steps': [50]})
grid_search.fit(iris.data, iris.target)

body:
Hi, I ran same code in grid_search_test.py and got the same error in TF 1.3.0, scikit-learn 0.19
Have you any idea?

import tensorflow as tf
from tensorflow.contrib import learn
from sklearn.model_selection import GridSearchCV
from sklearn import datasets
iris = datasets.load_iris()
feature_columns = learn.infer_real_valued_columns_from_input(iris.data)
classifier = learn.DNNClassifier(feature_columns=feature_columns, hidden_units=[10, 20, 10], n_classes=3)
grid_search = GridSearchCV(classifier, {'hidden_units': [[5, 5], [10, 10]]}, scoring='accuracy', fit_params={'steps': [50]})
grid_search.fit(iris.data, iris.target)


/Users/rickypark/anaconda/envs/handson-ml/lib/python3.6/site-packages/sklearn/model_selection/_search.py:583: DeprecationWarning: "fit_params" as a constructor argument was deprecated in version 0.19 and will be removed in version 0.21. Pass fit parameters to the "fit" method instead.
  '"fit" method instead.', DeprecationWarning)
\---------------------------------------------------------------------------
TypeError                                 Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-10-995caf033e7d> in <module>()
----> 1 grid_search.fit(iris.data, iris.target)

~/anaconda/envs/handson-ml/lib/python3.6/site-packages/sklearn/model_selection/_search.py in fit(self, X, y, groups, **fit_params)
    622                                      n_candidates * n_splits))
    623
--> 624         base_estimator = clone(self.estimator)
    625         pre_dispatch = self.pre_dispatch
    626

~/anaconda/envs/handson-ml/lib/python3.6/site-packages/sklearn/base.py in clone(estimator, safe)
     60     for name, param in six.iteritems(new_object_params):
     61         new_object_params[name] = clone(param, safe=False)
---> 62     new_object = klass(**new_object_params)
     63     params_set = new_object.get_params(deep=False)
     64

TypeError: __init__() got an unexpected keyword argument 'params'
